title: Exhaust Butterfly Cables - Removal

body.body: Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle - including DO NOT support on non integral parts
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
Failure to follow the advice above could result in serious injury or death.
If the engine has recently been running, the exhaust components can be hot.
Always allow the hot components to cool before working on the exhaust system.
Contact with the hot components could cause minor to moderate burns to exposed skin.
The exhaust butterfly valve cable with the yellow text has a 6 mm barrel end for the exhaust butterfly motor and a coloured black 90째 bend for the actuator end.
The exhaust butterfly valve cable with the white text has a 5 mm barrel end for the exhaust butterfly motor and a coloured silver 90째 bend for the actuator end.
Note the position of each inner and outer cable for installation.
Detach the outer cables from the exhaust butterfly actuator motor casing.
Align the inner cables with their slots on the exhaust butterfly actuator motor and remove the cables.

Perform the following operations:
Seats - Removal
Battery - Removal
Belly Pan - Removal
Rear Suspension Unit - Removal
Exhaust Butterfly Actuator Motor - Removal
The exhaust butterfly valve cable with the yellow text has a 6 mm barrel end for the exhaust butterfly motor and a coloured black 90째 bend for the actuator end.
The exhaust butterfly valve cable with the white text has a 5 mm barrel end for the exhaust butterfly motor and a coloured silver 90째 bend for the actuator end.
Note the position of each inner and outer cable for installation.
Detach the outer cables from the exhaust butterfly actuator motor casing.
Align the inner cables with their slots on the exhaust butterfly actuator motor and remove the cables.
